category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 1 (Basis of Establishment and Name)
contents: Article 1 (Basis of Establishment and Name) ① This corporation is a merger of the (former) Korean Sports Council established pursuant to Article 33 of the National Sports Promotion Act and the (former) National Sports Council established pursuant to Article 7 of the Sports Promotion Act. The National Olympic Committee of the Republic of Korea, which is a non-governmental, non-profit sports organization established in accordance with the amended provisions of Article 33 of the National Sports Promotion Act and which has no limitation on its existence period, and which has joined the International Olympic Committee (IOC) , abbreviated as NOC), is an organization that succeeded the Korean Olympic Committee (abbreviated as KOC), which joined the International Olympic Committee on June 20, 1947. Revised on June 8, 2017, ② The name of this corporation is the Korea Sports Council (hereinafter referred to as *Sports Council), and in English it is Korean Sport & It is called the Olympic Committee (abbreviated as KSOC).
